question: What comes once in a minute, twice in a moment, but never in a thousand years?
I have cities but no houses, forests but no trees, and rivers but no water. What am I?
The more you take, the more you leave behind. What am I?
I speak without a mouth and hear without ears. I have no body, but I come alive with the wind. What am I?
You see a boat filled with people. It hasn’t sunk, but when you look again, you don’t see a single person on the boat. Why?
What has to be broken before you can use it?
I’m tall when I’m young, and I’m short when I’m old. What am I?
What month of the year has 28 days?
What is always in front of you but can’t be seen?
What can you catch but not throw?
I have keys but open no locks. I have space but no room. You can enter, but you can’t go outside. What am I?
What runs all around a backyard, yet never moves?
What can travel all around the world without leaving its corner?
What has hands but can’t clap?
I shave every day, but my beard stays the same. What am I?
The more of me you take, the more you leave behind. What am I?
I have branches, but no fruit, trunk, or leaves. What am I?
What has one eye but can’t see?
What has legs but doesn’t walk?
What comes at the end of everything?
